text: Adriaan Blaauw (April 12 1914â€”December 1 2010) was a Dutch astronomer. He was an expert on the development of groups of young stars and how they expand away from each other. He discovered that some massive stars, known as runaways, can be moving at speeds of hundreds of kilometers per second. He was the scientific director of the European Southern Observatory and later became its Director General. From 1976 to 1979 he was the President of the International Astronomical Union. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1993. ==References== Category:1914 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Dutch academics Category:Dutch astronomers Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:People from Amsterdam
title: Adriaan Blaauw
